channel.title: Comments on: Friday Go Forward: Week 60

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: The reason I'm doing Korean servers instead of KGS is because the style of play on KGS has become a bit monotonous for me as of late. You can always expect a similar style of play whenever you get a game. Korean servers provide a completely different cast of players that will force you to really rethink the way you approach the game if you're used to KGS games (which I realized I desperately needed after the last tournament).
item.content:encoded: The reason I’m doing Korean servers instead of KGS is because the style of play on KGS has become a bit monotonous for me as of late. You can always expect a similar style of play whenever you get a game. Korean servers provide a completely different cast of players that will force you to really rethink the way you approach the game if you’re used to KGS games (which I realized I desperately needed after the last tournament).

item.title: By: Blackstone
item.dc:creator: Blackstone
item.description: Why korean servers instead of kgs?

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Yeah it really sucks that neither Tygem or WBaduk is Mac friendly. I mean the iPad apps are okay, but I don't really care for playing on a tablet since it's hard to get records off and misclicks are a lot easier. Hopefully they fix that in the near future!
item.content:encoded: Yeah it really sucks that neither Tygem or WBaduk is Mac friendly. I mean the iPad apps are okay, but I don’t really care for playing on a tablet since it’s hard to get records off and misclicks are a lot easier. Hopefully they fix that in the near future!

item.title: By: Eyecatcher
item.dc:creator: Eyecatcher
item.description: I think this is a very good decission man! For me its the same, but as being a mac user i can tell you, it is not very easy and comfortable like kgs... both have html client , but the tygem one seems to ve not working (?!) any more... the wbaduk client works, but you definetly can't save kifu!!!! But maybe it is good training replay them or record them just after the game. I use vmware fusion for running the clients on windows.. but it slows down my mac enorm! So i can't "just play a quick wbaduk game" if i want to save the kifu.... and i can't chat or comunicate much with anybody.... but the games are strong and nice and i will, like you, more and more move to tygem&wbaduk nevertheless. Ps: i have i ipad and both have ipad apps... but the tygem can't export ir save kifu in any way and no chat at all! The wbaduk app saves kifu but can't export.
item.content:encoded:
I think this is a very good decission man! For me its the same, but as being a mac user i can tell you, it is not very easy and comfortable like kgs… both have html client , but the tygem one seems to ve not working (?!) any more… the wbaduk client works, but you definetly can’t save kifu!!!! But maybe it is good training replay them or record them just after the game. I use vmware fusion for running the clients on windows.. but it slows down my mac enorm! So i can’t “just play a quick wbaduk game” if i want to save the kifu…. and i can’t chat or comunicate much with anybody…. but the games are strong and nice and i will, like you, more and more move to tygem&wbaduk nevertheless.
Ps: i have i ipad and both have ipad apps… but the tygem can’t export ir save kifu in any way and no chat at all! The wbaduk app saves kifu but can’t export.

item.title: By: RisingStar
item.dc:creator: RisingStar
item.description: Well, I hope I'm not the first to admit that about 75% of my studying go is tesuji, life and death, etc. so this helps. Thanks a lot :)
item.content:encoded: Well, I hope I’m not the first to admit that about 75% of my studying go is tesuji, life and death, etc. so this helps. Thanks a lot ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: I had multiple ones for Tygem at one point, but I'm using "bengozen" on both servers now. (Fair warning, they haven't been played on in a while so the rank is pretty low). The most significant thing that he told me was to play games more often. About 50% of my studying of go should be playing. There were other tidbits, but that's the main thing.
item.content:encoded:
I had multiple ones for Tygem at one point, but I’m using “bengozen” on both servers now. (Fair warning, they haven’t been played on in a while so the rank is pretty low).
The most significant thing that he told me was to play games more often. About 50% of my studying of go should be playing. There were other tidbits, but that’s the main thing.

item.title: By: RisingStar
item.dc:creator: RisingStar
item.description: Sounds cool Ben. What usernames do you play by on WBaduk and Tygem? Also, what did Myung (9p) tell you to change? I've been doing pretty much what you have been doing so I would love to change my training regimen if you change yours :)
item.content:encoded:
Sounds cool Ben. What usernames do you play by on WBaduk and Tygem?
Also, what did Myung (9p) tell you to change? I’ve been doing pretty much what you have been doing so I would love to change my training regimen if you change yours ðŸ™‚
